intro: Jacobinia obtusior, commonly known as the broadleaf jacobinia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy surface. Jacobinia obtusior thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
